title: 1.5 Create .env.example files for server and client
description:
Create environment variable templates for both applications.

## Server .env.example
```
PORT=3000
WS_PORT=8080
DOWNLOAD_DIR=./downloads
CHUNK_SIZE=1048576
MAX_CHUNK_RETRY_ATTEMPTS=3
CHUNK_RETRY_DELAY=1000
HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL=30000
DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT=300000
LOG_LEVEL=info
```

## Client .env.example
```
CLIENT_ID=restaurant-001
SERVER_WS_URL=ws://localhost:8080
RECONNECT_INTERVAL=5000
MAX_RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS=10
HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL=30000
LOG_LEVEL=info
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- server/.env.example contains all server config variables
- client/.env.example contains all client config variables
- Comments explain each variable

title: 1.4 Create shared/protocol.js with message type constants
description:
Define all WebSocket protocol constants shared between server and client.

## MESSAGE_TYPES to Export
- REGISTER - Client registration
- REGISTER_ACK - Registration acknowledgement
- DOWNLOAD_REQUEST - Server requests file download
- DOWNLOAD_ACK - Client acknowledges download
- FILE_CHUNK - File chunk data
- RETRY_CHUNK - Request chunk retry
- DOWNLOAD_COMPLETE - Transfer completed
- CANCEL_DOWNLOAD - Cancel transfer
- ERROR - Error message
- PING - Heartbeat ping
- PONG - Heartbeat pong

## ERROR_CODES to Export
- CLIENT_NOT_FOUND
- CLIENT_NOT_CONNECTED
- FILE_NOT_FOUND
- FILE_READ_ERROR
- PERMISSION_DENIED
- DOWNLOAD_IN_PROGRESS
- DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT
- CHUNK_CHECKSUM_FAILED
- CHUNK_TRANSFER_FAILED
- INVALID_REQUEST

## Acceptance Criteria
- File exports MESSAGE_TYPES object
- File exports ERROR_CODES object
- Can be imported by both server and client

## Blocked By
- 1.1 (needs shared/ directory)

title: 1.7 Create configuration loaders
description:
Create configuration modules that load and validate environment variables.

## Files to Create
- server/src/config.js
- client/src/config.js

## Server Config Properties
- port (default: 3000)
- wsPort (default: 8080)
- downloadDir (default: ./downloads)
- chunkSize (default: 1048576)
- maxChunkRetryAttempts (default: 3)
- chunkRetryDelay (default: 1000)
- heartbeatInterval (default: 30000)
- downloadTimeout (default: 300000)
- logLevel (default: info)

## Client Config Properties
- clientId (required)
- serverWsUrl (default: ws://localhost:8080)
- reconnectInterval (default: 5000)
- maxReconnectAttempts (default: 10)
- heartbeatInterval (default: 30000)
- logLevel (default: info)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Loads environment variables with dotenv
- Provides sensible defaults for optional values
- Throws descriptive error for missing required values
- Exports frozen config object

## Blocked By
- 1.5 (needs .env.example for reference)
- 1.6 (needs logger for error reporting)

title: 1.6 Setup Winston logger utility
description:
Create logging infrastructure for both server and client.

## Files to Create
- server/src/utils/logger.js
- client/src/utils/logger.js

## Logger Features
- Configurable log level via LOG_LEVEL env var
- Timestamp in ISO format
- Log level prefix (info, warn, error, debug)
- Console transport
- Optional file transport

## Log Format
```
2026-01-21T10:30:00.000Z [INFO] Message here
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Both files export configured Winston logger
- Log level configurable via environment variable
- Logs include timestamp, level, and message

- 1.3 (needs winston dependency in client)
